repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR (on top of #5845 and its dependencies) is sufficient to compile all the built modules in the Plex folder of Cython. It's currently unknown if they actually work (since it really needs all of Cython to be built to test).

(Last limited API change for the time being... I think there's plenty to be getting on with)

comment_data.body: Could you move this into the two cases that need it? It's needlessly turns a simple one-line expression into three in a common case. (same below)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1881,24 +1887,37 @@ def generate_traverse_function(self, scope, code, cclass_entry):
         if base_type:
             # want to call it explicitly if possible so inlining can be performed
             static_call = TypeSlots.get_base_slot_function(scope, tp_slot)
+            code.putln("{")

comment_data.body: I don't think it makes sense to use the same guard for both conditions.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1096,7 +1096,7 @@ def __init__(self, old_binops):
             EmptySlot("tp_weaklist"),
             EmptySlot("tp_del"),
             EmptySlot("tp_version_tag"),
-            SyntheticSlot("tp_finalize", ["__del__"], "0", ifdef="PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030400a1",
+            SyntheticSlot("tp_finalize", ["__del__"], "0", ifdef="CYTHON_USE_TP_FINALIZE",
                           used_ifdef="CYTHON_USE_TP_FINALIZE"),

comment_data.body: I'm not sure that we're not overusing `CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS` in such cases. There's really no reason why `PyList_GET_SIZE()` would fail for a Python list object. Up for debate, but it *feels* excessive.
This can probably be restructured into a simpler sequence of conditions, rather than nesting them. Especially given the separate decref below, which seems non-trivial to reason about.

Are you saying that this should probably just be doing `PyList_Size` for the limited API only, and there's no need to change this so it affects PyPy (for example)?

I'm happy to go with that - it's probably easier
Yes this was the wrong fix. I should be applying `used_ifdef` to the `slots[]` table.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1096,7 +1096,7 @@ def __init__(self, old_binops):
             EmptySlot("tp_weaklist"),
             EmptySlot("tp_del"),
             EmptySlot("tp_version_tag"),
-            SyntheticSlot("tp_finalize", ["__del__"], "0", ifdef="PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030400a1",
+            SyntheticSlot("tp_finalize", ["__del__"], "0", ifdef="CYTHON_USE_TP_FINALIZE",
                           used_ifdef="CYTHON_USE_TP_FINALIZE"),

comment_data.body: I've done all the comments but this one (which I'd like to check I've understood first)

> Are you saying that this should probably just be doing `PyList_Size` for the limited API only, and there's no need to change this so it affects PyPy (for example)?

Yes. Let's stick with that pattern, until we have an actual reason to change it.

To make it clear, this applies to the size reading, definitely. I'd keep the `SAFE_MACROS` guard for calls like `GET_ITEM()`, because PyPy, for example, really actually has to do something here in that it needs to allocate a `PyObject` representation of the Python object. So there are realistic reasons why this might fail. Reading a plain C value seems entirely harmless in comparison.
Is it due to the module state or heap types / type specs?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1795,9 +1795,15 @@ def generate_dealloc_function(self, scope, code):
                 # cimported base type pointer directly interacts badly with
                 # the module cleanup, which may already have cleared it.
                 # In that case, fall back to traversing the type hierarchy.
-                code.putln("if (likely(%s)) __Pyx_PyType_GetSlot(%s, tp_dealloc, destructor)(o); "
-                           "else __Pyx_call_next_tp_dealloc(o, %s);" % (
-                               base_cname, base_cname, slot_func_cname))
+                # If we're using the module state then always go through the
+                # type hierarchy, because our access to the module state may
+                # have been lost (at least for the limited API version of
+                # using module state).
+                code.putln("#if !CYTHON_USE_MODULE_STATE")

comment_data.body:
With the surrounding braces, we can safely simplify the if-statement.
```suggestion
                code.putln("{")
                code.putln(f"inquiry clear = __Pyx_PyType_GetSlot({base_cname}, tp_clear, inquiry);")
                code.putln("if (clear) clear(o);")
                code.putln("}")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1951,17 +1970,27 @@ def generate_clear_function(self, scope, code, cclass_entry):
                 code.putln("%s(o);" % static_call)
             elif base_type.is_builtin_type:
                 base_cname = base_type.typeptr_cname
-                code.putln("if (!%s->tp_clear); else %s->tp_clear(o);" % (
-                    base_cname, base_cname))
+                code.putln("{")
+                code.putln(f"inquiry clear = __Pyx_PyType_GetSlot({base_cname}, tp_clear, inquiry);")
+                code.putln("if (!clear); else clear(o);")
+                code.putln("}")

comment_data.body: I submitted https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5882 to draw a clean line.

Definitely module state.

I think the crash was in `PyState_FindModule` in destructors being called as Python shut down.

It's a much more general problem of course, since destructors can call arbitrary Python code which might need to access module state itself. But this covers a very common case in the Cython-generated part of the code.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1795,9 +1795,15 @@ def generate_dealloc_function(self, scope, code):
                 # cimported base type pointer directly interacts badly with
                 # the module cleanup, which may already have cleared it.
                 # In that case, fall back to traversing the type hierarchy.
-                code.putln("if (likely(%s)) __Pyx_PyType_GetSlot(%s, tp_dealloc, destructor)(o); "
-                           "else __Pyx_call_next_tp_dealloc(o, %s);" % (
-                               base_cname, base_cname, slot_func_cname))
+                # If we're using the module state then always go through the
+                # type hierarchy, because our access to the module state may
+                # have been lost (at least for the limited API version of
+                # using module state).
+                code.putln("#if !CYTHON_USE_MODULE_STATE")

comment_data.body: I've apply this with the merge for `ASSUME_SAFE_SIZE`... doesn't seem worth rerunning the CI for this alone.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1951,17 +1970,27 @@ def generate_clear_function(self, scope, code, cclass_entry):
                 code.putln("%s(o);" % static_call)
             elif base_type.is_builtin_type:
                 base_cname = base_type.typeptr_cname
-                code.putln("if (!%s->tp_clear); else %s->tp_clear(o);" % (
-                    base_cname, base_cname))
+                code.putln("{")
+                code.putln(f"inquiry clear = __Pyx_PyType_GetSlot({base_cname}, tp_clear, inquiry);")
+                code.putln("if (!clear); else clear(o);")
+                code.putln("}")

commit.message:
Build all Plex/*.so modules in the Limited API

This PR (on top of #5845 and its dependencies) is sufficient to
compile all the built modules in the Plex folder of Cython.
It's currently unknown if they actually work (since it really needs
all of Cython to be built to test).
Some small fixes to regular build
Fix crash due to using module state during shutdown
Most of the comments from review
PyPy fix and getsize in limited api
